medical_history.chief_complaint: Dyspnea and cyanosis in a neonate at birth.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at birth, with cyanosis and apathy noted 10 minutes after birth. The neonate required gastric tube feeding and intermittent oral suction due to inability to clear airway secretions. After treatment with IVIG and oral pyridostigmine, the neonate was weaned off the ventilator by day 9 and started bottle feeding at 17 days of age. Symptoms resolved by day 26 of life.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The mother was diagnosed as a hepatitis B carrier one year prior to pregnancy. The maternal grandmother had a 10-year history of ocular myasthenia gravis.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother has a history of ocular myasthenia gravis.
